qas.question: What is the academic study of the Somali people called?
Along with sociology, linguistics, historiography and archaeology, what field is part of Somali Studies?
Along with chronicles and records, what indigenous sources are used in Somali Studies?
What is the name of the annual gathering of Somali Studies scholars?

answers.text: the International Congress of Somali Studies

qas.question: When did the International Congress of Somali Studies begin?

context: The scholarly term for research concerning Somalis and Greater Somalia is known as <a0_0>Somali Studies<a0_0/>. It consists of several disciplines such as <a1_0>anthropology<a1_0/>, sociology, linguistics, historiography and archaeology. The field draws from old Somali chronicles, records and <a2_0>oral literature<a2_0/>, in addition to written accounts and traditions about Somalis from explorers and geographers in the Horn of Africa and the Middle East. Since <a4_0>1980<a4_0/>, prominent Somalist scholars from around the world have also gathered annually to hold <a3_0>the International Congress of Somali Studies<a3_0/>.
